issues.description: In the solution, the server’s PersonResource maps GET and PUT operations under “v2/persons” while POST and DELETE use “persons”, yet the client’s PersonController always sends requests to “persons” (and the problem statement never mentions a “v2” prefix). This mismatch between the server path mappings and the client/prompt will prevent any GET or PUT calls from reaching the server and will confuse students about the correct endpoint URLs.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the endpoint mappings so that all PersonResource methods use the same base path (e.g. remove the “v2/” prefix and map GET and PUT to “persons” like POST and DELETE), matching the client’s URIs and the prompt’s specifications.

issues.description: The solution’s PersonResource class inconsistently prefixes the GET and PUT endpoints with “v2/” (e.g. @GetMapping("v2/persons") and @PutMapping("v2/persons/{personId}")), whereas the problem statement and client code uniformly expect unversioned "/persons" endpoints. This mismatched naming prevents students’ client requests from reaching the server and creates confusion mapping the specified endpoints to their implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the “v2/” prefix so that all mappings use "persons" consistently (e.g. change @GetMapping("v2/persons") to @GetMapping("persons") and @PutMapping("v2/persons/{personId}") to @PutMapping("persons/{personId}")).
